This function obtains and verifies the signature on the code specified by the code object. It checks the validity of all sealed components, including resources (if any). It validates the code against a code requirement if one is specified. The call succeeds if all these conditions are satisfactory.

This call is only secure if the code is not subject to concurrent modification, and the outcome is only valid as long as the code remains unmodified. If the underlying file system has dynamic characteristics, such as a network file system, union mount, or FUSE, you must consider how secure the code is from modification after validation.
When checking a universal binary, include the

flag. Otherwise the method verifies only one slice of the binary, potentially indicating success without testing all the slices. Be aware that the slices of a universal binary donâ€™t have to be signed by the same signer for the test to pass. One slice might be ad hoc signed, for example. But the validity check doesnâ€™t know which slice you are going to run. For example, the user might use the arch(1) command line utility to pick a 32-bit architecture even though a 64-bit architecture is available.
If you want to be sure to test a particular slice, create the static code object with the
method using the
and
attributes (if you know the architecture) or the
attribute (if you know the offset into the universal binary).

abstract.text: Secure the data your app manages, and control access to your app.
Values that can be used in the
parameter to most code signing functions.
Creates a code requirement object by compiling a valid text representation of a code requirement.
Creates a code requirement object by compiling a valid text representation of a code requirement and returns detailed error information in the case of failure.
A static code object representing signed code on disk.
Creates a static code object representing the code at a specified file system path using an attributes dictionary.
Recognize result codes specific to the code signing services API.
For multi-architecture (universal) Mach-O programs, validate all architectures included.

A key whose value indicates the offset of a Mach-O specific slice of a universal Mach-O file.
